Course Name: PERSONAL HEALTH
Description:
This course examines the leading causes of death and disability in the United States with an emphasis on the
 application of knowledge and skills to reduce risk and enhance the quality of life.

Course Name: COMMUNITY HEALTH EDUCATION
Description:
Identification of community health problems and measures for control. Emphasizes principles, objectives and
 methods of community health education.

Course Name: WINNING COMBINATION:HEALTH AND ATHLETES
Description:
An exploration of strategies for promoting healthy lifestyles for athletes. The course is reserved for varsity
 athletes.

Course Name: MEDICAL TERMINOLOGY
Description:
Identification of the meaning of various roots and terms and combining forms that are components of medical
 words, including anatomical physiological and pathological therapeutic terminology and implications for health
 literacy.

Course Name: TEACHING HEALTH TO YOUNG LEARNERS
Description:
Investigate current health issues relevant to children in primary grades,and identify educational strategies to
 increase student health knowledge, foster positive health attitudes and promote healthy behaviors.

Course Name: INTRODUCTION TO HEALTH EDUCATION
Description:
This course introduces the student to the health education profession. Roles and responsibilities of health
 educators in a variety of occupational settings are described.

Course Name: HEALTH EDUCATION THEORIES
Description:
Application of various attitude and behavior models to health and illness behavior in order to develop a
 framework for educational intervention.

Course Name: DRUG USE AND MISUSE
Description:
Introduction to the study of drug/alcohol abuse. Basic pharmacology of drug actions is reviewed. Common
 myths misconceptions about drug alcohol
use are examined. Current drug problems and related prevention
treatment issues are analyzed.

Course Name: METHODS AND APPLICATIONS OF HEALTH EDUCATION
Description:
Analysis observation, demonstration and experience in the teaching-learning process utilizing methods,
 materials and resources appropriate to the preparation of professional health educators. This course includes 50
 field/clinical hours. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII)
 and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at
 their assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will
 take place.

Course Name: HUMAN SEXUALITY
Description: A study of the role and meaning of human sexuality throughout the life cycle for self and society.

Course Name: MARKETING IN HEALTH EDUCATION
Description:
Examines the basic elements of marketing processes as they relate to promoting health in communities.
 Emphasis on application of marketing planning, concepts and practices for service providers involved with
health education.

Course Name: CONSUMER HEALTH
Description:
An overview of the health marketplace including health products, services, financing, promotional practices and
 consumer protection laws.

Course Name: PROGRAM PLANNING AND EVALUATION IN HEALTH EDUCATION
Description:
Provides students with the knowledge and skills to assess health resources and needs, develop health programs
 to meet specific needs in particular populations and determine appropriate measures to evaluate the
 effectiveness of health programs.

Course Name: SMALL GROUP PROCESSES
Description:
(Cross-listed with CES 37800) Group processes in human relationships, including techniques of democratic
 leadership and effective group membership. This course includes 25 field/clinical hours.

Course Name: EMERGENCY MEDICAL TRAINING
Description:
Basic immediate care procedures for victims of acute illnesses and accidents. Course does not conform to EMT-
B National Standard Curriculum
as adopted by the Ohio Department of Public Safety, Division of EMS.

Course Name: VARIABLE TITLE WORKSHOP IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 50093 and 70093) Discussion of major issues in health and
 safety education. Content emphasis and prerequisites vary depending on workshop.

Course Name: HEALTH COACHING
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 52041) Techniques of health coaching and motivational interviewing applied to health
 education. Individual and group approaches relative to personal, family and societal health issues.

Course Name: STUDENT TEACHING IN HEALTH EDUCATION
Prerequisites:
Eligibility for admission to student teaching and admission to advanced study; and official validcertification of Child Safety Training, approved Basic Life Support and A.L.I.C.E. Training must be presented to
 the campus office of clinical experience or designated faculty/staff at Regional campuses as prerequisite for
student teaching.
Description:
Provides a twelve week student teaching experience. See student teaching
section of catalog. Students are
 required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of
Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their assigned
 school/agency before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take place.

Course Name: HEALTH AND LEARNING: STRATEGIES FOR STUDENTS AND TEACHERS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 52575) Focus on health issues/education/environment policy and practice/community
 strategies to
respond to threats confronting students utilizing a coordinated school/community strategy to
 promote health to improve academic outcomes. CPR and first aid certification required for completion of course.

Course Name: WOMEN'S HEALTH ISSUES
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 54025) Traditional and feminist analysis of women's health issues and the health
 educational responses to those issues.

Course Name: INTERNSHIP IN COMMUNITY HEALTH EDUCATION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Participation for one academic semester in the health education activities of an approved
 agency, organization or industry.

Course Name: SPECIAL TOPICS: HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Selected topics related to public health issues facing professionals in communities,
 schools, health care settings and the worksite.

Course Name: INDIVIDUAL INVESTIGATION IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 54096 and 74096) Independent reading and/or research directed
 by a HED faculty member.

Course Name: ADMINISTRATION OF SCHOOL HEALTH PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 54543) Organizational design and administration of a comprehensive school health
 program including health services, instruction and environment. This course includes 25 field/clinical hours. CPR
 and first aid certification required for completion of course.

Course Name: SEXUALITY EDUCATION PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 54544) This course prepares the student to develop, implement and evaluate sexuality
 education programs in school and community settings.

Course Name: DRUG ABUSE AND VIOLENCE EDUCATION PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 54550) Drug abuse and violence prevention from theoretical, philosophical, empirical
 and practical perspectives. Application of theories to plan, implement, and evaluate drug and violence education
 programs.

Course Name: STRESS:RECOGNITION AND MANAGEMENT
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 56052) An examination of stress, its role as a predisposing factor for various illnesses
 and diseases, types of stressors, the body's reaction to stress, and techniques for recognizing, preventing and
 reducing stress.

Course Name: ADVANCED HUMAN SEXUALITY
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 56057) Selected aspects of human sexuality; history, cross-cultural perspectives,
 medical/surgical conditions and sex therapy and counseling.

Course Name: HEALTH RELATED ASPECTS OF AGING
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 56070) Theories of biological aging and identification of major health hazards, age-
related diseases and age changes, their prevention and control. The health care delivery system for the elderly.

Course Name: AIDS:ISSUES, EDUCATION AND PREVENTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 57070) This course provides an extensive overview
of the human immunodeficiency
 virus epidemic as it has developed and exists today. A particular emphasis will be given to aids education and
prevention issues and strategies.

Course Name: CURRENT ISSUES IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 57091 and 77091) Public health issues facing professionals in
 communities, schools, health care settings and the worksite.

Course Name: FIELD EXPERIENCE IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 58092 and 78092) Observation and participation in educational
 and promotional activities of a public health agency,school or health care facility. Joint university agency
 supervision.

Course Name: INQUIRY SEMINAR INTO PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE
Description:
Interdisciplinary inquiry into teaching as a professional practice in health education; emphasis on teacher as
 disciplined investigator. Utilization of teaching and learning technology.

Course Name: VARIABLE TITLE WORKSHOP IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 40093 and 70093) Discussion of major issues in health and
 safety education. Content emphasis and prerequisites vary depending on workshop.

Course Name: HEALTH COACHING
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 42041) Techniques of health coaching and motivational interviewing applied to health
 education. Individual and group approaches relative to personal, family and societal health issues.

Course Name: HEALTH AND LEARNING:STRATEGIES FOR STUDENTS AND TEACHERS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 42575) Focus on health issues/education/environment policy and practice/community
 strategies to
respond to threats confronting students, utilizing a coordinated school
community strategy to
 promote health and improve academic outcomes. CPR
first aid certification required for completion of course.

Course Name: WOMEN'S HEALTH ISSUES
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 44025) Traditional and feminist analysis of women's health issues and the health
 educational responses to those issues.

Course Name: INDIVIDUAL INVESTIGATION IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 44096 and 74096) Independent reading and/or research directed
 by a graduate faculty member. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and
 Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to
authorized personnel at their assigned school/agency before the first day of the semester in which student
 teaching/ internship will take place.

Course Name: ADMINISTRATION OF SCHOOL HEALTH PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 44543) Organizational design and administration of a comprehensive school health
 program including health services, instruction and environment. This course includes 25 field/clinical hours. CPR
 and first aid certification required for completion of course.

Course Name: SEXUALITY EDUCATION PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 44544) This course prepares the student to develop, implement and evaluate sexuality
 education programs in school and community settings.

Course Name: DRUG ABUSE AND VIOLENCE EDUCATION PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 44550) Drug abuse and violence prevention from theoretical, philosophical, empirical,
 and practical perspectives. Application of theories to plan, implement, and evaluate drug and violence education
 programs.

Course Name: ADVANCED HUMAN SEXUALITY
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 46057) Selected aspects of human sexuality: history, cross-cultural perspectives,
 medical/surgical therapy and counseling.

Course Name: HEALTH RELATED ASPECTS OF AGING
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 46070) Theories of biological aging and identification of major health hazards, age-
related diseases and age changes, their prevention and control. The health care delivery system for the elderly.

Course Name: AIDS:ISSUES, EDUCATION AND PREVENTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 47070) This course provides an extensive overview
of the human immunodeficiency
 virus epidemic as it has developed and exists today. A particular emphasis will be given to AIDS education and
prevention issues and strategies.

Course Name: CURRENT ISSUES IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 47091 and 77091) Public health issues facing professionals in
 communities, schools, health care settings and the worksite.

Course Name: FIELD EXPERIENCE IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 48092 and 78092) Observation and participation in educational
 and promotional activities of a public health agency,school, or health care facility joint university-agency
 supervision. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and
 Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their
 assigned school/agency before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take
place.

Course Name: THESIS I
Description:
Thesis students must register for a total of 6 hours, 2 to 6 hours in a single semester distributed over several
 semesters if desired.

Course Name: THESIS II
Description: Thesis students must continue registration each semester until all degree requirements are met.

Course Name: INTRODUCTION TO RESEARCH AND DATA ANALYSIS IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND
Description:
PROMOTION
Introduction of research methods in the field of health education and health promotion. Includes basic
 knowledge and skills in research design
and concepts of descriptive and inferential statistics.

Course Name: HEALTH BEHAVIOR
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84050) Analysis of a broad range of theoretical and empirical models of health and
 illness behavior.

Course Name: BIOBEHAVIORAL ASPECTS OF DISEASE PREVENTION IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND
Description:
PROMOTION
The etiology and pathogenesis of major diseases are studied from a biopsychosocial perspective with an
 emphasis on implications for disease
prevention, health promotion and behavioral intervention.

Course Name: NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND PROGRAM PLANNING IN HEALTH PROMOTION
Prerequisites: HED 64061 and HED 64050 and HED 64063 and HED 64059 and graduate standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84055) Students will assess individual and community needs for health promotion
 programs based on multiple sources of health data. Students will develop a rational plan to meet identified
 needs.

Course Name: EVALUATION OF HEALTH PROMOTION PROGRAMS
Prerequisites: HED 64050 andHED 64055 and HED 64061 and HED 64063 and graduate standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84057) Reviews basic principles and types of evaluations. Students will develop an
 evaluation plan to determine effectiveness of program developed in HED 6/74055.

Course Name: DEVELOPMENTAL APPROACH TO CONTENT AND RESOURCES IN HEALTH EDUCATION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84058) Focus on examination of six CDC problem priority areas through the lens of
 developmentally appropriate practice parameters for children and youth.

Course Name: COMMUNICATION AND MARKETING IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Prerequisites:
HED 64050 and HED64061 and
graduate standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84059) Introduction to the theory and practice of
planning, implementing, and
 evaluating marketing and communication programs in health promotion.

Course Name: FOUNDATIONS OF HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84061) Historical, sociological and philosophical
factors that have influenced definitions
 and the practice of health education and promotion are studied. Professional associations/leadership,
 government initiatives, standards of practice and accreditations are examined.

Course Name: ADMINISTRATION OF HEALTH PROMOTION PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84062) Basic concepts in the administration of health education/promotion programs.
 Coordination of program services, consultative relationships, management of human and fiscal resources and
 organizational leadership are addressed.

Course Name: STRATEGIES IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84063) Health education and promotion methods, techniques and strategies are
 presented for a variety of audiences, learning environments and intervention levels.

Course Name: WORKSITE HEALTH PROMOTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84070) Program planning and evaluation of health promotion programs in business and
 industry with an emphasis on the role
of health educators.

Course Name: ADVOCACY AND POLICY ISSUES IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84080) Emphasizes the advocacy role of health educators. Includes use of research
 results to develop, analyze and influence health policy.

Course Name: READINGS IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Prerequisites: Graduate standing and Health Education (HED) or Public Health (PH) major.
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 84082) Independent study of approved topics in health and safety education related to
 the student's special interests. Adviser's permission required to repeat registration one time.

Course Name: COLLEGE TEACHING OF HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 84094) Guided experiences
in teaching selected undergraduate
 courses.

Course Name: PROJECT IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 84098) Research or individual investigation for master's level
 graduate students.

Course Name: VARIABLE TITLE WORKSHOP IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 40093 and 50093) Discussion of major issues in health and
 safety education. Content emphasis and prerequisites vary depending on workshop.

Course Name: INDIVIDUAL INVESTIGATION IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 44096 and 54096) Independent reading and/or research directed
 by a graduate faculty member. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and
 Identification (BCII) and Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to
authorized personnel at their assigned school/agency before the first day of the semester in which student
 teaching/ internship will take place.

Course Name: CURRENT ISSUES IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 47091 and 57091) Public health issues facing professionals in
 communities, schools, health care settings and the worksite.

Course Name: FIELD EXPERIENCE IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with HED 48092 and 58092) Observation and participation in educational
 and promotional activities of a public health agency,school or health care facility joint university-agency
 supervision. Students are required to complete Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification (BCII) and
 Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) background checks and submit the results to authorized personnel at their
 assigned ¿school/agency¿ before the first day of the semester in which student teaching/ internship will take
 place.

Course Name: DISSERTATION I
Description:
(Repeatable for credit)Registration for two semesters required, first semester dissertation work begins and
 continues until completion of 30 hours.

Course Name: PRACTICUM IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) In this course, students obtain permission to work with an individual faculty member on
 research, community projects, or other professional activities in various health education settings (school,
 community, medical care, worksite). Assignments are individualized to meet the needs of the practicum
 experience.

Course Name: DISSERTATION II
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Continuing registration required of doctoral students who have completed the initial 30
 hours of dissertation and continuing until degree requirements are met.

Course Name: RESIDENCY SEMINAR: SYNTHESIS OF LITERATURE IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND
Prerequisites: doctoralstanding and special approval of instructor.
Description:
PROMOTION
Exploration of philosophical, theoretical and empirical issues in health
education and promotion. Students
 synthesize courses, research and practice in preparation for comprehensive examinations.

Course Name: SEMINAR:PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
Focuses on the process, practice and documentation of professional development in health education and
 promotion in the areas of instruction, program development, research and evaluation.

Course Name: RESIDENCY SEMINAR: RESEARCH PROPOSAL, DEVELOPMENT AND PRESENTATION
Prerequisites: Doctoralstanding and special approval of instructor.
Description:
Review of the role of research and scholarly pursuits in the professorate, the professional health education
 literature, and in the development and dissemination of a range of scholarly products. Identification of requisite
 elements of a dissertation in health education and promotion. Refinement of a professional vita, updating of
doctoral program prospectus, specification of dissertation topic, identification of potential dissertation
 committee members, development and presentation of draft dissertation proposal.

Course Name: HEALTH EDUCATION PRACTICE
Description:
Investigation of various health education settings including analysis of
agency programming efforts and
 comparison to evidence-based practice. Application of community assessment, socioecological model, and
community-based participatory research principles. Analysis of how health education theory and research are
 implemented in various practice
settings.

Course Name: RESEARCH DISSEMINATION AND TECHNICAL WRITING IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND
Description:
PROMOTION
Examination and practice of technical writing for research proposals, technical reports, and journal publications
 in health education and promotion. Other methods of disseminating research such as preparation and
 submission of conference presentation applications and writing as part of consultative relationships with
 community agencies is explored.

Course Name: ADVANCED PROGRAM EVALUATION IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Prerequisites: HED 64055 or HED 74055; and HED 64057 or HED 74057; and doctoral standing.
Description:
A review of evaluation methods used in health education programs. Emphasis is placed on data collection
 procedures, linking program activities to outcomes, participant attrition and reporting of the results.

Course Name: APPLIED THEORY IN HEALTH EDUCATION RESEARCH AND PRACTICE
Description:
Examination of theory/models/hypotheses applied to specific health behaviors. Emphasis on operationalization
 of theoretical constructs.

Course Name: INTRODUCTION TO RESEARCH AND DATA ANALYSIS IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND
Description:
PROMOTION
Introduction of research methods in the field of health education and health promotion. Includes basic
 knowledge and skills in research design
and concepts of descriptive and inferential statistics.

Course Name: HEALTH BEHAVIOR
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64050) Analysis of a broad range of theoretical and empirical models of health and
 illness behavior.

Course Name: BIOBEHAVIORAL ASPECTS OF DISEASE PREVENTION IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND
Description:
PROMOTION
(Cross-listed with HED 64051) The etiology and pathogenesis of major diseases are studied from a
 biopsychosocial perspective with an emphasis
on implications for disease prevention, health promotion and
 behavioral
intervention.

Course Name: NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND PROGRAM PLANNING IN HEALTH PROMOTION
Prerequisites: HED 64050 or 84050; and HED 64059 or 84059; and HED 64061 or 84061; and HED64063 or 84063; and doctoral standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64055) Students will assess individual and community needs for health promotion
 programs based on multiple sources of health data. Students will develop a rational plan to meet identified
 needs.

Course Name: EVALUATION OF HEALTH PROMOTION PROGRAMS
Prerequisites: HED 64050 or84050; and HED 64055 or 84055; and HED 64061 or 84061; and HED 64063 or 84063; and doctoral standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64057) Reviews basic principles and types of evaluations. Students will develop an
 evaluation plan to determine effectiveness of program developed in HED 6/84055.

Description:

 developmentally appropriate practice parameters for children and youth.

Course Name: COMMUNICATION AND MARKETING IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Prerequisites:
HED 64050 or 84050;and HED
64061 or 84061; and doctoral standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64059) Introduction to the theory and practice of
planning, implementing, and
 evaluating marketing and communication programs in health promotion.

Course Name: FOUNDATIONS OF HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64061) Historical, sociological and philosophical
factors that have influenced definitions
 and the practice of health education and promotion are studied. Professional associations/ leadership,
 government initiatives, standards of practice and accreditations are examined.

Course Name: ADMINISTRATION OF HEALTH PROMOTION PROGRAMS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64062) Basic concepts in the administration of health education/promotion programs.
 Coordination of program services, consultative relationships management of human and fiscal resources and
organizational leadership are addressed.

Course Name: STRATEGIES IN HEALTH EDUCATION AND PROMOTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64063) Health education and promotion methods, techniques and strategies are

Course Name: HEALTH IN THE DEVELOPING NATIONS
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64066) Overview of national development, review of problems process and strategy of
 health development.

Course Name: WORKSITE HEALTH PROMOTION
Description:
(Cross-listed with HED 64070) Program planning and evaluation of health promotion programs in business and
 industry with an emphasis on the role
of health educators.

Description:

Description:

in teaching selected undergraduate
 courses.

Description:
